definition: owner/master/host/individual or party concerned/God/Lord/main/to indicate or signify/trump card (in card games)
topic/problem for discussion/exam question/subject/to inscribe/to mention/CL:個|个[ge4],道[dao4]

sentences.english: Theme song from Saiunkoku Monogatari anime.
When I was listening to the final theme song, my heart was kind of stirred and could not calm down.
sentences.chinese: 听着最后的主题曲，我的心情久久不能平静。

sentences.english: A solo violin carried the theme in “The Fixer”;
sentences.chinese: 在《暗影行动》中，主题曲由小提琴独奏出。

sentences.english: The theme song of the XXIX Beijing Olympic Games was sung by Liu Huan and Sarah Brightman.
sentences.chinese: 北京奥运会主题曲由刘欢和莎拉布莱曼演唱。

sentences.english: What better theme music for globalization?
sentences.chinese: 还有比这更好的全球化主题曲吗？

sentences.english: TV drama theme songs sang by Wei Lian.
sentences.chinese: 由伟联演唱的电视剧主题曲。

sentences.english: Finally, the title track is a simple break-up leading to heartbreak song.
sentences.chinese: 最后，主题曲是一首简单的导致伤心的分手歌。

sentences.english: Both shows have catchy title songs.
sentences.chinese: 两者都有琅琅上口的主题曲。

sentences.english: Fairy Tail Main Theme piano ver.
sentences.chinese: 妖精的尾巴主题曲钢琴版。
我们哼唱着电影《碟中谍》的主题曲。

sentences.english: The words are the title of the theme song from the television show “M*A*S*H.”
sentences.chinese: 这是电视剧《MASH》主题曲的歌名。

sentences.english: The theme song of Xiamen TV , 2008. It's very magnificent and heart-stirring .
sentences.chinese: 2008年厦门卫视主题曲，大气磅礴，励志动听。

sentences.english: The music piece is adapted by the theme song of the famous movie Waterloo Bridge .
sentences.chinese: 乐曲由著名影片《魂断蓝桥》的主题曲改编。

sentences.english: As the theme song of the World Cup goes, this is the time for Africa.
sentences.chinese: 正如南非世界杯主题曲唱的那样，非洲时刻已经来临。

sentences.english: This is the theme song of SuperTsea Season 2.
sentences.chinese: 这是超人阿谢第二辑的主题曲。

sentences.english: Some of his themes became standards.
sentences.chinese: 他的一些主题曲成了一种标准。

definition: sung performance/to sing for an audience
music played during a movie, play etc/incidental music/music played in a theatrical interlude/(fig.) incident/episode
opening titles (of movie)/leader (blank film at the beginning and end of a reel)
to compose a piece of music
